intro: Gaultheria bolivari, commonly known as the Bolivian wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Gaultheria bolivari is often found in high-altitude forests and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves contain aromatic compounds, which contribute to its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
